title: Cross-Browser Implementation Complete
details:
Successfully completed full cross-browser compatibility implementation following the guide at docs/manual/v1.6.0/cross-browser-manifest-v2-guide.md.

## Implementation Summary

### What Was Implemented:
1. ✅ Polyfill integration (webextension-polyfill@0.12.0)
2. ✅ Cross-browser manifest.json configuration
3. ✅ Container API shim for Chrome compatibility
4. ✅ Build scripts (copy-polyfill, package-firefox, package-chrome)
5. ✅ Code updates with defensive checks
6. ✅ Comprehensive documentation (README, implementation summary)
7. ✅ Memory storage for future reference

### Verification:
- ✅ Context7 MCP: Confirmed polyfill usage patterns
- ✅ Perplexity MCP: Validated cross-browser approach
- ✅ All 1909 unit tests passing
- ✅ ESLint clean (zero errors)
- ✅ Build succeeds consistently

### Browser Support:
- Firefox/Zen: Full features (container isolation)
- Chrome/Edge/Brave/Opera: Core features (single default container)

### Key Files:
- manifest.json: Loads polyfill before all scripts
- src/shims/container-shim.js: Chrome compatibility layer
- scripts/copy-polyfill.cjs: Build automation
- scripts/package-firefox.cjs & package-chrome.cjs: Packaging
- docs/implementation-summaries/cross-browser-manifest-v2-implementation.md: Complete guide

### Package Commands:
```bash
npm run build           # Build for both browsers
npm run package:firefox # Create .xpi
npm run package:chrome  # Create .zip
```

### Next Steps:
Manual testing on both Firefox and Chrome recommended to verify real-world behavior.
